title: A koinon honours Sextus Peducaeus
support: Although damaged around the edges, the block appears essentially intact top, left and below, but appears to have been cut down on the right, with a significant part of the text (same block or a second block?) missing from the right. The stone is a soft coarse stone of poor quality and the surface is not well preserved. The block was found in re-use in a later wall.

layout.p: Five lines of Greek text. Interlineation suggests a clear vacat below the fifth line (40-60mm). Left margin of the text is irregular (varies between 15 and 70 mm), and appears original, suggesting that the text was approximately centred on the stone.

handNote.lettering: Lunate epislon and sigma, with broken bar alpha, xsi of the form of I with extended cross-bars. Letters of a plain, regular and wide module.

provenanceFound._: Found winter 2006/7, following partial collapse of the rear wall of room b of the building of the so-called 'altar with three betyls' immediately to the south of the agora

provenanceObserved._: Prag 2017-07-18. autopsy of plaster cast, Palermo Soprintendenza

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2017-07-28

repository._: Area Archeologica e Antiquarium di Solunto

museum.name: Area Archeologica e Antiquarium di Solunto
museum.description: There are two museum buildings at the site. The first, at the entrance, gives an overview of the site and its excavations, then treats some of the individual buildings and areas within the site. The inscriptions are here (from the theatre). The second, at the exit, contains the small finds, and begins with the archaic (indigenous and punic layers), then moves to the Hellenistic and Roman periods. There are numerous ceramics, some sculpture, some wall paintings and mosaics

location.address: Via Collegio Romano, 90017 - Solunto Santa Flavia (PA)

bibl.author: Calascibetta and Di Leonardo
bibl.title: Un nuovo documento epigrafico da Solunto
bibl.citation: A. M. G. Calascibetta e L. Di Leonardo, «Un nuovo documento epigrafico da Solunto», in Sicilia occidentale. Studi, rassegne, ricerche, a c. di Carmine Ampolo (Pisa: Edizioni della Normale, 2012), 37–47
